title: Check for inconsistent access declaration
body:
*Original issue*: https://gitlab.com/lfortran/lfortran/-/issues/280

At the time of writing, the --show-asr for

```fortran
module access_vars
implicit none
private
public print_vars

real :: priv  = 1.5
real, public, private :: publ = 2.5

contains

subroutine print_vars()
print *, "priv = ", priv
print *, "publ = ", publ
end subroutine print_vars

end module access_vars
```

returns

```
(TranslationUnit (SymbolTable 1 {access_vars: (Module (SymbolTable 2 {print_vars: (Subroutine (SymbolTable 3 {}) print_vars [] [(Print () [(Str "priv = " (Character 8 [])) (
Var 2 priv)]) (Print () [(Str "publ = " (Character 8 [])) (Var 2 publ)])] () () Public), priv: (Variable 2 priv Local (ConstantReal "1.5" (Real 4 [])) Default (Real 4 []) Private), publ: (Variable 2 publ Local (ConstantReal "2.5" (Real 4 [])) Default (Real 4 []) Private)}) access_vars)}) [])
```

The last access declaration is what is ultimately assigned since we currently loop through attributes assuming access would only be declared once. But this should be a semantic error.
